item.title: Barry Bonds: The Best Hitter of All Time?
item.description: On August 7, 2007 Barry Bonds enshrined his name into baseball and sports history. Just a few nights earlier Bonds hit home run 755 in San Diego with his arch nemesis Bud Selig watching from a suite. Then on a cold and windy summer night in the City by the bay, Bonds hit a towering home run into the right center bleachers to break Hank Aaronâ€™s home run record.

item.title: Golden State Warriors: An Offensive Juggernaut
item.description: The 21st century saw basketball change. The game has developed so much over the last 21 years. But the game has also drastically changed over the last few years. Teams have begun shooting the ball at rates far higher than we have ever seen before. One of the main reasons for that is the Golden State Warriors. Following a disappointing first round exit to the Los Angeles Clippers in 2014, the Warriors ownership group decided to fire Mark Jackson and hire then TV analyst Steve Kerr.
